properties.areaDesc: Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; Jefferson and West Douglas Counties Above  6000 Feet/Gilpin/Clear Creek/Northeast Park Counties Below 9000 Feet
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 9 at 11:58AM MST until February 9 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
...SNOW AND SLICK TRAVEL CONDITIONS FOR THE MOUNTAINS AND
FOOTHILLS...

.Snow will gradually decrease along the I-25 Corridor through the
afternoon, with main roads and highways staying wet. Meanwhile,
in the mountains and foothills, expect more snow and slick travel
conditions to persist through the afternoon, and even well into
the evening along the I-70 mountain Corridor through Summit
County.

* WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches.
Heaviest storm totals will occur in the foothills of Jefferson
County where up to 8 inches can be expected.

* WHERE...The Southern Front Range Foothills and The Northern
Front Range Foothills.

* WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
